data.prayer: Father, please raise up prophets in Sunamganj who can call the church to holiness and purity, preparing your church as a bride for your Son.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Sunamganj, Sylhet, Bangladesh

data.prayer: Jesus, please help the 3,092 believers in the county of Sunamganj to be filled with joyful obedience at all times, as you modeled for us all.
Over 99.57 percent of the people of Sunamganj are far from Jesus. Lord, please send your gospel to them through the internet or radio or television today!
Father, encourage your church in Sunamganj that you never forsake them.
data.verse: Those who know your name will put their trust in you, for you, Yahweh, have not forsaken those who seek you.

data.prayer: Lord, Let your Kingdom come among the Kawar people. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.
Father, please reward those who diligently seek you with a heart of faith in the county of Sunamganj.
data.verse: Without faith it is impossible to be well pleasing to him, for he who comes to God must believe that he exists, and that he is a rewarder of those who seek him.

data.prayer: Father, we ask for 493 new simple churches in the county of Sunamganj, Sylhet, Bangladesh. Place a simple church in every community of the 2,468,000 people living here.
data.verse: And blessed be His glorious name forever; And may the whole earth be filled with His glory. Amen, and Amen.

data.prayer: Spirit, defend the church in the county of Sunamganj against being inward-focused.
data.verse: The Spirit of the Sovereign LORD is on me, because the LORD has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to bind up the brokenhearted, to proclaim freedom for the captives and release from darkness for the prisoners.

location.name: Sunamganj
location.people_groups_list: Madari (Muslim traditions), Kuli, Mallah (Hindu traditions), Kunbi (Hindu traditions), Jat (Sikh traditions)
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Madari (Muslim traditions) (4,600), Kuli (400), Mallah (Hindu traditions) (15,000), Kunbi (Hindu traditions) (500), Jat (Sikh traditions) (19,000)
